alert.note: Alert for Northwest Fayette; Northwest Pocahontas; Southeast Fayette; Southeast Nicholas; Southeast Pocahontas; Southeast Raleigh; Southeast Randolph; Southeast Webster (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 24 at 6:42AM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...Gusty showers will impact portions of southwestern Randolph, Pocahontas, southeastern Nicholas, southeastern Webster and southern Fayette Counties through 715 AM EDT... At 641 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking gusty showers along a line extending from 10 miles northwest of Snowshoe to near Oak Hill. Movement was east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Richwood, Rainelle, Marlinton, Cass Scenic Railroad, Babcock State Park, Oak Hill, Mount Hope, Snowshoe, Bradley, Piney View, Meadow Bridge, Hillsboro, Pax, Thurmond, Dunmore, Cranberry Mountain Nature Center, Slaty Fork, Minnehaha Springs, Frost and Nettie. This includes the following highways... West Virginia Turnpike between mile markers 53 and 54. Route 19 between mile markers 4 and 11. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Northwest Fayette; Northwest Pocahontas; Southeast Fayette; Southeast Nicholas; Southeast Pocahontas; Southeast Raleigh; Southeast Randolph; Southeast Webster
